title.value: RAPD analysis of genetic variability of 62-396 apple rootstock at in vitro and in vivo cultivating
RAPD-анализ генетической вариабельности подвоя яблони 62-396 при культивировании in vitro и in vivo

person.name: Kukharchik, N.V., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Potato, Vegetable and Fruit Growing (Belarus). Institute for Fruit Growing

abstract.value: The research work was accomplished in the biotechnology department of the Institute for Fruit Growing in 2010-2011 in the conditions of the Republic of Belarus. The RAPD analysis of genetic variability of apple (Malus) clonal rootstock 62-396 cultivated in vivo and in vitro (for 5 years and for 6 months) was accomplished. 5 oligonucleotide primers out of 40 tested demonstrated spectrum of discrete and clearly identifiable bands on agarose gel. It was established that the rootstock 62-396 at primary stages of micro propagation (6 months) had larger polymorphism rate (33,3%) than after a cultivation in vitro for 5 years (17,3% ). Analysis of 62-396 plants cultivating in the field also demonstrated genetic variability of the studied samples (polymorphism rate made 18,42%).
